CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings before ORG against his employer , company PERSON and CARDINAL further defendants .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG came into force in respect of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first defendant , company PERSON replied to the claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was requested to supplement or amend his claim .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged his submissions by which he withdrew the action against the second , third , fourth and fifth defendant and proposed to determine another court with subject matter jurisdiction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court stayed the proceedings against the second , third , fourth and fifth defendant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision by which it dismissed the applicant ’s request to determine another court with subject matter jurisdiction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court adjourned the first main hearing at the request of both parties .
CARDINAL . On DATE the settlement hearing and the first main hearing were held .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second main hearing was held .
CARDINAL . On DATE the scheduled hearing was postponed at the applicant ’s request .
CARDINAL . Between DATE and DATE further CARDINAL hearings were held .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partially upheld the applicant ’s claim and dismissed the remainder of the claim . Both parties appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeals and issued a decision that an appeal on points of law would not be allowed in the present case . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the decision that appeal on points of law was not allowed . The applicant lodged a constitutional appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s constitutional appeal .
